result.execSummary:
The defendant Haleigh L. Palchik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.
Must seek and maintain full-time employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with child support orders and arrearages.  Maintain at least twice monthly contact with her child support worker, until the agent and her worker deem it no longer necessary.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Reading of the information waived.  Defendant plead no contest to all the counts in the information.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of 5 counts of Failure to pay child support < 120 days, contrary to 948.22(3).  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.  All concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Comply with her child support orders and arrearages.  DNA sample.  Seek and maintain full time employment.  Not to terminate without her agent's prior consent.  Maintain at least twice monthly contact with her Child Support worker.  

Court ordered sentence withheld,  3 years probation.  All concurrent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Comply with her child support orders and arrearages.  Seek and maintain full time employment.  Not to terminate without her agent's prior consent.  Maintain at least twice monthly contact with her Child Support worker, until the agent and her worker deem it no longer necessary.    CC.  DNA not required.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrine .  Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  She stated she understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing.
Sent to Judge electronically
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.  Set for plea/sentencing.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Terrien.  Defense requesting bond modification.  Bond modification not needed.

Pre-trial conference on March 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on March 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  She stated she understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court advised the defendant of her right to attorney.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint. AIA 2/13/17 at 9 am.
Added to bond calendar at request of A.P. in DA's office.
body only.
Defendant failed to appear.  DA states complaint was mailed to address on complaint and has not been returned undelivered.  Court authorized an arrest warrant.
